title: Notification Widget needs to have solid background color
comment: It's hard to see the controls for the notification widget (probably because I'm running a custom cm12 theme). At any case, everything else works as intended. It can play 3pg files and other video files and that's what I'm looking for.

title: Extraordinary
comment: This is a very good music player especially considering that it's free. One of the few apps I really feel obligated to rate. The Replay Gain is a really nice tool that makes up for android's lack of volume control. One problem is that there is no update library button. I use the Music Player app to update. The libraries are connected do it works great.
Good

title: Awesome app.
comment: Vanilla has never given me any troubles. Clean, easy to use, will always be my go-to music player.

title: Close to great
comment: I had to knock off a star because as good as this app is, it badly badly badly needs a library refresh option. It is a royal pain when I add music to my phone, have to fix the tags on the tracks, and the old track names remain in the library until I restart my phone. There has to be some way to fix that. When it happens, you'll get your 5th star from me.

title: FOSS and Clean
comment: I like the interface and the clearness of this app. Keep up!

title: It's alright.
comment: It's kinda slow sometimes.
Good
Replaygain support!

title: Great
comment: I really like the cleanliness and simplicity of the interface.
Great music player with Replay Gain support (the only free and open source Android player I could find with Replay Gain, actually).

title: Customizable, open source, love it!
comment: Simple, fast, customizable.

title: It needs to get internet radios
comment: Wonderful and opensource player: is there a way to get internet streaming, as for internet radios?

title: The music player I always wanted.
comment: Google's music player has lots of strange behaviors when it's offline, so I was looking for something that could handle music stored on my phone. This free, opensource app has almost every feature I could want!  My favorite features (hidden in settings):  - Start playing when launched (great for when you're in the car)  - Playlists  - Only play through headphone (can't mistakenly play over external speaker)  Still missing a few features I'd like, but since it's open source, I can add them myself!

title: Simple and great Opensource music player
comment: Please add more feature, maybe add EQ for a better experience.

title: I city
comment: Rrrrfgyyyddf die

title: Great
comment: A very nice music player, I'd go as far as to say the best one I've used. Simple, fast and stable. Developer cares about bugs and opinions of users and reacts to them, all in all a wonderful app that's become a must-have on my list.
thanks!
Thank you for letting us go back to the black theme!

title: Love this-Offline!!
comment: Just wish you could fast foward via Bluetooth... I don't need trackers and such....definitely don't need my music player to be online! Thanks for bringing back the dark theme also!

title: Dark theme please!
comment: Material design is good but whitish backgrounds are a sore to my eyes. Edit: thank you!!

title: Pretty good actually!
comment: I am using Omich Player - also a Vanilla/Apollo fork and I really like it for how it handles embedded album art. This Vanilla fork however seems to also behave well and not compress embedded artwork. It doesn't seem to be a ram hog either. The Material Design implementation is basic but with some polish this can be up there with the most popular play store players.

title: More reliable now
comment: Its nice and light, and less buggy! The sound is great, and it supports playlists and other files! There is some lack of customisation, but I don't mind.
Kept stopping in the middle of a track. Also refused to play next track. I did like the way it paused when it losses audio focus.
Open source

title: Nice and light.
comment: No frills and behaves well. Pleasingly customisable. Only quirks:   1 - Isn't registered as a music activity in Android. You have to add a direct link to the app in Car Home instead of Car Home just figuring out you want the Music button to launch Vanilla.  2 - It'd be nice to have an option to view album art thumbnails in the Library Screen.

title: It plays music
comment: This app is wonderful. It plays music. All formats, all music. The UI is very nice while still putting functionality before appearance.   It doesn't have an EQ or video support because it is a music player. Please keep it that way!

title: Could be better
comment: Please make that I could configure what does the headset button do.

title: Easy, powerful, respectful
comment: I love that it can play all of my preferred formats (including ogg & flac gapless). The user interface is simple and clean. Best of all for me is that it doesn't nose into permissions it doesn't need, like my location or Internet access. My music files are all stored on the device, yet other music players require full network permissions and to be able to track my location. Thank you for respecting my privacy!

title: Material ui.
comment: My favorite player. It would be nice to have some material design. ❤

title: Fantastic and Simple
comment: Plays all my file types. I love the simple design and interface. Very good options and settings, things like 'External output only' are awesome.   I've easily settled on this as my player of choice.

title: Nice.
comment: Very impressed with the interface. It used to allow me to update the library for newly added music, but that's gone now :-(
The function was removed because it didn't do anything on newer (4.2) android versions and startet to trigger a fatal exception on 4.4 :-(

title: This is the best and simplest player.
comment: Idk why this isn't promoted more it beats every other music player I've tried. Keep it up.

title: How do I put covers on the albums
comment: I really love this app it plays music very well but I'm not quite sure how to put a cover on so please if anyone knows please tell me
Vanilla Music will search for a 'cover.jpg' file: Simply put the cover image into the folder of the album (eg: /sdcard/Music/artist_name/album_name/cover.jpg) and it will pick it up after some time.

title: Player of choice
comment: I'm using it ever since I had the Samsung Galaxy 550. It's friendly with older Android systems and it has some great features, starting by the automatic playlist creation when you tap a folder, the preamp gain which is very useful if you have a low output gain on your headphones, and the random playback mode which doesn't merely switch between tracks completely at random, but also lets you go back to the songs you were playing earlier.
Its nice
excellent

title: Perfect!

title: Perfect

title: Malware!  Do not install.
comment: I only installed this app because another (bad) app required it.  After that, this app pkaced itself on my home screen without permission!  Uninstalled it immediately..

I have no idea how you came to this conclusion: Vanilla Music is opensource (https://github.com/adrian-bl/vanilla) and only requests a minimal set of permissions. (The worst it could do is to - ehr.. play music). Also note that placing freshly installed apps on the home screen is a *standard feature* of android itself.

title: The best and then some
comment: Better than all the cluttered players out there. Feature request - pls add gapless playback for mp3/m4a and CM DSP manager support. Great work Adrian!!! I am buying the donate version now.

Gapless playback for MP3 will only happen if Google decides to implement some hacks in the MediaPlayer library: The MP3 format simply does not (unlike OGG or FLAC) have a standard way to implement gapless.
Adding DSP manager support is possible - but i don't have a CM device to test it. Send me an e-mail if you would like to help testing it.

title: Still wondering how it's free
comment: An app of this quality is rarely free. (Gladly buying the Donate app!) The only thing missing is an equalizer. Supports a variety of formats, matches the Jellybean 4.2 theme flawlessly, easy to use. Playlists are also easy to manage. Beats most paid apps out there. The homescreen and lockscreen widgets are also great! The thing with equalizers is, once I start messing with them, each song has its own "best" settings, where the music feels great to you... So in the interest of my sanity, I thank the dev for *not* including one! But I'd love to have some basic tag editing. :)

title: I love it!
comment: I have tried several different players but this is the best. It has the prettiest widgets, has cool customization controls, is fast and clean (no annoying ads so far), AND it scrobbles to Last.fm. It's totally worth the try.  I wish it had a previous/next button on the lock screen though, it's the only thing I've missed.

title: Very Clean
comment: I toyed around with this and I can certainly say this is probably my favorite music player on the market right now. No ads, awesome layout, seriously give this app a shot.  If this player had a 4x2 widget, it would be perfect.

title: Clean, but still manages to be confusing
comment: I handle all my songs via folders rather than tags, and clicking though folders seems to be backwards. Touching the folder names plays the whole folder, where it's intuitive the touch the folder to open the folder. Icon on the right should be for playing the folder, rather than opening.  Also, FLAC still didn't work for me (GS3 with CM10).  Otherwise nice and clean, especially compared to Mortplayer which seems to have feature-bloated a bit.
